subject: Re: [junit] Junit NOT failing on fail()
msgSnippet: ... Consider using one of the GUI testing frameworks (Abbot, JFCUnit, Jemmy) that handles these threading issues for you.
messageBody:
vainiov wrote:
> Hi all,
>
> I'm trying to test a UI application. I'm using JUnit with NetBeans 4.1
> and Ant 3.8.1.
>
> I have contents in one test method like this:
> - - - -
> //fail("place 1");
> try {
> javax.swing.SwingUtilities.invokeAndWait (new Runnable () {
> public void run () {
> // do some UI testing
> }
> });
> } catch (Exception e) {
> fail(e.toString());
> }
>
> System.out.println("Foobar!");
> System.out.flush();
> fail("place 2");
> - - - -
>
> When I look at the Ant build log, I DO see the output "Foobar!", but
> nothing about the test failure. If I uncomment the line fail("place
> 1"); then the Ant build will fail normally.
>
> So the question is, why does the test's possibility to fail properly
> get disabled from doing some stuff in between?
>
> (Actually, it doesn't get completely disabled. The test execution
> would stop when fail() gets executed, but nothing is reported about
> the failure.)
>
> This is really annoying, and I can't find anything like this from FAQs
> on by googling. Any help would be much appreciated.

Consider using one of the GUI testing frameworks (Abbot, JFCUnit, Jemmy)
that handles these threading issues for you.
